comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Douglas A-4E Skyhawk 152015 VX-5 ‘Vampires’ tail code XE and side number 6 On the static line at an airfield open house Edwards Air Force Base May 1969 A-4E 152015 was used only as an air to ground ordnance test plane during the urgent era of the Vietnam War. The US Navy accepted A-4E 152015 on April 28 1965 and it went straight to VX-5 on April 30, 1965 as a weapons test platform. Then spent five years flying from Naval Air Station China Lake California It only flew until September 9, 1970. While over China Lake ‘B’ Range, the pilot had to eject after test firing folding fin aircraft rockets (FFAR) that may have broken up – the engine ingested the debris causing it to fail with the loss of the aircraft. a4skyhawk.org/content/buno-152015-vx-5-xe-6-0 A-4E 152015 VX-5 ‘Vampires’ code XE side number 6. Circa 1965 Photo Credit: Ray Powell VX-5 A-4E BuNo 152015, XE-6, circa 1965. Ordnance from l-r is Fireye, Shrike, Sadeye, Walleye; can not really see #1, but it might be Rockeye a4skyhawk.org/content/152015-vx-5-official-us-navy-photo-... A-4E 152015 VX-5 ‘Vampires’ code XE side number 6. China Lake, CA Dated June 6,1968 official U.S. Navy photo right side view of Vampires Skyhawk BuNo 152015, XE-6, FAE ordnance. commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:A-4_with_ZAP.png a4skyhawk.org/content/152015-vx-5-official-us-navy-photo-... A U.S. Navy Douglas A-4E Skyhawk (BuNo 152015) from Air Test and Evaluation Squadron 5 (VX-5), carrying a ZAP rocket pod at NAWC China Lake, 19 January 1970 Official U.S. Navy photo a4skyhawk.org/content/152015-vx-5-photographer-unknown-g-... A-4E 152015 Edwards AFB 18 May 1969 right side view of Vampires Skyhawk BuNo 152015, XE-6, on the Edwards AFB flight line. a4skyhawk.org/content/4e-buno-152015 A-4E 152015 Edwards AFB 18 May 1969 VX-5 Vampires A-4E Skyhawk BuNo 152015, XE-6, tail close-up, Edwards AFB. Photo from Clay Jansson Collection, courtesy A. Romano www.navarchives.com a4skyhawk.org/content/buno-152015-vx-5-xe-6 Douglas A-4E Skyhawk 152015 VX-5 ‘Vampires’ code XE side number 6 Edwards AFB May 1970 Photo Credit: Hansen Description: BuNo 152015 of VX-5.
